column5: After seeing the weather report, I couldn't pass up walleye fishing.  And the weather did not disappoint.  Light winds, overcast and pi$$ing rain most of the morning was how she went.  It only took about twenty minutes for my side to go off.  A nice two and a half pound eye on a perch walleye diver spit it at the boat after a few violent head shakes.  After that, the trolling bite went dead, so we decided to look for some weed beds.  We finally found something to our liking in about 10 - 12.  We managed to pop one nice 3 lb walleye, two nice OOS largemouth and an absolutely ENORMOUS sheepshead.  I've caught plenty of them before, and this was easily the biggest I have ever seen.  I kept hoping it was an eye but deep down I knew it wasn't.  The bigger of the two largemouth:   The gigantic sheepshead, weighing in at 14 pounds flat.   And of course, dinner.   And I managed to lose two crankbaits to what I can only assume were pike.
Good stuff Bud. Glad you had a good morning. A hat trick before noon is always fun.
That's one big sheepy. Thanks for posting.
nice one ........i cant take it anymore....aaaarrrrghhhhh!   but seriously...lol....great stuff , looks like you had a blast!
You got to ice fish way the hell more than me, so shaddap.
Nice fish. That drum is big! clean looking bass.
Awsome day wtg on the hat trick!!! Thanks for posting.....
Great report and pics Joeytier  That's a good mix bag of fish you got into.... Congratulations That sheephead is a big one for sure Thanks for sharing Leechman
Thats sheepshead is huge...i want to catch one!
Looks like a great day! that Sheepshead must have been a great battle!
